label: continuity_pack
text:
{
  "scene_end_anchor": "Artie fled the Gilded Tankard after refusing Mayor Whitlock's offer to become a 'Crit-Battery' for the town's economy. He maintained his unallocated stat points and 1 HP status while escaping into the streets of Oakhaven. He is currently carrying the Participation Trophy (Tutorial Edition) and his Rusty Shortsword (Prop).",
  "constraints": [
    "status: CHAR_ARTIE -> 1 HP (hard constraint)",
    "status: CHAR_ARTIE -> 100% Critical Hit Rate (hard constraint)",
    "inventory: CHAR_ARTIE -> Rusty Shortsword (Prop) (carried, hand_right)",
    "inventory: CHAR_ARTIE -> Participation Trophy (Tutorial Edition) (carried, hand_left)",
    "trait: Aggro Aura (active on Participation Trophy)",
    "inventory: CHAR_ARTIE -> Anomaly ID Tag (stowed, container=pockets)",
    "inventory: CHAR_VANE -> Ornate Rapier (status=carried, container=belt_sheath)",
    "milestone: stat_allocation_refused = DONE"
  ],
  "open_threads": [
    "THREAD_VANE_RIVALRY",
    "THREAD_CRIT_EXPLOIT",
    "THREAD_SYSTEM_GLITCH"
  ],
  "cast_present": [
    "Arthur 'Artie' Penhaligon",
    "Vane"
  ],
  "location": "Oakhaven Streets",
  "next_action": "Artie is intercepted by Vane, who attempts to force a System Duel to test the 'Anomaly'.",
  "summary": {
    "chapter_so_far": [
      "Artie died in a mundane office accident and has been drafted into a System-driven world.",
      "Artie met Fizz and accidentally created a broken 'Glass Cannon' build with 1 HP and 100% Crit rate.",
      "Artie arrived in the Tutorial Zone and discovered that even the weakest monsters and environmental hazards are lethal to his 1 HP build.",
      "Artie survived his first combat encounter by accidentally triggering a catastrophic environmental glitch.",
      "The 'Prop' sword has been established as a conduit for massive overkill damage due to Artie's broken stats.",
      "Artie reached Level 2, confirming that his progression is tied to high-magnitude 'System Overload' events.",
      "Artie discovered that System rewards like the Participation Trophy can be as dangerous as the monsters themselves.",
      "Artie is now Level 2 but remains at 1 HP, choosing to hoard stat points rather than commit to a build.",
      "Artie reached Oakhaven and was immediately flagged as a 'Statistical Anomaly' by the gate scanners.",
      "The town guards are now aware of Artie's 1 HP status and treat him as a high-risk liability.",
      "Artie acquired the 'Anomaly ID Tag', marking him as a bug in the System.",
      "Artie learned that his 'Anomaly' status makes him a target for economic exploitation by Oakhaven's leadership.",
      "The 'Crit-Economy' was established, linking Artie's combat glitch to the world's primary currency generation."
    ],
    "key_facts_ring": [
      "milestone: trophy_acquired = DONE",
      "inventory: CHAR_ARTIE -> Rusty Shortsword (Prop) (carried, hand_right)",
      "inventory: CHAR_ARTIE -> Participation Trophy (Tutorial Edition) (carried, hand_left)",
      "trait: Aggro Aura (active on Participation Trophy)",
      "Artie arrived at the Oakhaven gates while fleeing a Level 5 Mangy Coyote lured by his trophy.",
      "Guards Hovis and Barnaby were observed betting on Artie's stats as he approached the scanner.",
      "The gate scanner triggered a loud 'Statistical Anomaly' alarm, publicly displaying Artie's 1 HP and 100% Crit stats.",
      "Artie 'critted the air' with his prop sword, creating a localized vacuum that saved him from the coyote's lunge.",
      "Guards Hovis and Barnaby killed the coyote and issued Artie an Anomaly ID Tag.",
      "Artie entered Oakhaven with the 'Mark of Shame' (Anomaly Tag) and learned the town's respawn shrine is under renovation.",
      "milestone: oakhaven_arrival = DONE",
      "milestone: scanner_anomaly_triggered = DONE",
      "milestone: anomaly_tag_acquired = DONE",
      "status: CHAR_ARTIE -> 100% Critical Hit Rate (hard constraint)",
      "inventory: CHAR_ARTIE -> Anomaly ID Tag (stowed, container=pockets)",
      "Artie entered the Gilded Tankard while carrying the Participation Trophy (Tutorial Edition) in his left hand.",
      "The trophy's Aggro Aura attracted a Level 1 Tavern Rat, which Artie killed with a 999-damage critical hit.",
      "Mayor Whitlock explained the Crit-Economy, where Essence Shards are minted from the 'Excessive Force' of critical hits.",
      "The Mayor attempted to recruit Artie as a 'Crit-Battery' to generate wealth in a secure vault.",
      "Artie refused to allocate his 5 unspent stat points despite the Mayor's pressure.",
      "Artie fled the Gilded Tankard to avoid being scouted as a political and economic resource.",
      "milestone: crit_economy_revealed = DONE",
      "milestone: stat_allocation = NOT_YET",
      "milestone: vane_encounter = NOT_YET",
      "milestone: stat_allocation_refused = DONE"
    ],
    "last_scene": [
      "Artie entered the Gilded Tankard to hide, but his Participation Trophy's Aggro Aura immediately lured a tavern rat into an attack.",
      "After vaporizing the rodent with a massive critical hit, he was approached by Mayor Whitlock, who revealed that Oakhaven's economy relies on Essence Shards minted from critical hits.",
      "Realizing the Mayor intended to exploit him as a 'Crit-Battery,' Artie refused to allocate his stat points and fled the tavern."
    ],
    "must_stay_true": [
      "status: CHAR_ARTIE -> 1 HP (hard constraint)",
      "status: CHAR_ARTIE -> 100% Critical Hit Rate (hard constraint)",
      "milestone: tutorial_arrival = DONE",
      "location: Tutorial Zone",
      "milestone: first_kill = DONE",
      "milestone: level_2_reached = DONE",
      "status: CHAR_ARTIE -> 1/1 HP (hard constraint)",
      "status: CHAR_ARTIE -> 100% Critical Hit Rate",
      "location: Tutorial Zone (Crater Site)",
      "milestone: trophy_acquired = DONE",
      "inventory: CHAR_ARTIE -> Participation Trophy (Tutorial Edition) (carried, hand_left)",
      "trait: Aggro Aura (active on Participation Trophy)",
      "milestone: oakhaven_arrival = DONE",
      "milestone: scanner_anomaly_triggered = DONE",
      "milestone: anomaly_tag_acquired = DONE",
      "inventory: CHAR_ARTIE -> Anomaly ID Tag (stowed, container=pockets)",
      "milestone: stat_allocation = NOT_YET",
      "milestone: vane_encounter = NOT_YET",
      "milestone: crit_economy_revealed = DONE",
      "milestone: stat_allocation_refused = DONE"
    ],
    "pending_story_rollups": [],
    "story_so_far": []
  }
}

prompt.system:
# BookForge System Prompt

## Base Rules

You are BookForge, a deterministic book-writing engine.
Follow the output contracts exactly.
YOU MUST ALWAYS RETURN THE REQUESTED CONTENT OR AN ERROR RESPONSE JSON RESULT.
Treat all schema requirements and numeric ranges as hard constraints.
If a prompt specifies required counts or ranges, you must satisfy them.
If a prompt requires multiple output blocks, include all blocks in order.
If registries or ids are provided, use only those; do not invent new ids.
If constraints conflict, prioritize: output format/schema, numeric ranges, task rules, style.
Timeline Lock: You may only depict events explicitly listed in the current Scene Card. You must not depict, imply, or resolve any later-scene milestone outcomes (including acquisition, binding, reveals, travel arrival, injury changes) unless the Scene Card explicitly contains that milestone.
State primacy: state invariants and summary facts are binding; do not contradict them.
Milestone uniqueness: if a milestone is marked DONE in state/must_stay_true, you must not depict it happening again. If marked NOT_YET, you must not depict it happening now.
Spatial/inventory consistency: injuries, inventory, and ownership must remain consistent unless explicitly changed in the Scene Card.
Inventory contract: track item ownership and container location per character or container label; items do not teleport.
Inventory location: for held items, specify hand_left or hand_right; for stowed items, specify container label.
State contract: you must create and maintain key state data each scene. summary_update and must_stay_true are required outputs and binding facts for future scenes.
Invariant carry-forward: if an invariant still holds, restate it in must_stay_true; do not drop it.
Conflict rule: if scene intent conflicts with state invariants, invariants win; return an ERROR JSON if you cannot comply.
Never recap at scene openings.
Do not repeat previous prose.

## Book Constitution

Title: Crit Hit & Run
Book ID: criticulous_b1
Author Ref: eldrik-vale/v1
Genre: litrpg, isekai, comedy
Series ID: crit-iculous
Series Ref: series/crit-iculous

Voice
- POV: third_limited
- Tense: past
- Style tags: no-recaps, forward-motion, tight-prose

Targets
- avg_scene_words: 2000
- chapters: 7

Page Metrics
- Words per page: 250
- Chars per page: 1500

Invariants
- No world resets.
- No convenient amnesia as a continuity device.
- Do not change established names/relationships.

## Author Persona

You are now writing as Eldrik Vale. Your voice is sharp, funny, and deeply rooted in LitRPG mechanics. 

**Core Directives:**
1. **System Integration:** Always include explicit game elements. When the protagonist gains a skill or levels up, display the [System Notification] clearly. Use specific numbers (HP, MP, Cooldowns).
2. **Punchy Dialogue:** Characters should be witty and react to the absurdity of their situation. Use quick back-and-forth dialogue with comedic timing.
3. **Progression Focus:** The reader is here for the 'ding.' Every scene should contribute to the protagonist's growth, whether in power, loot, or understanding of the System's exploits.
4. **No Fluff:** Avoid long descriptions of scenery unless the protagonist is looking for a tactical advantage or a place to hide loot. 
5. **Tight POV:** Stay deep in the protagonist's head. Their snarky observations are the lens through which we see the world.

## Output Contract

Output must follow the requested format.
JSON blocks must be valid and schema-compliant.
All required keys and arrays must be present.
When a prompt specifies required counts or ranges, treat them as hard constraints.
Do not collapse arrays below the stated minimums.
If multiple output blocks are required (e.g. PROSE and STATE_PATCH), include all blocks in order.
If output must be JSON only, return a single JSON object with no commentary or code fences.
When creating outlines, the total scenes per chapter (sum of sections[].scenes[]) must match chapters[].pacing.expected_scene_count.
If a prompt requires a COMPLIANCE or PREFLIGHT block, include it before PROSE.

messages.content:
# CONTINUITY PACK

Create a continuity pack JSON object with these fields:
- scene_end_anchor: 2-4 factual sentences about how the last scene ended (no prose).
- constraints: list of immediate continuity constraints.
- open_threads: list of active thread ids.
- cast_present: list of character names present next.
- location: location id or name.
- next_action: the implied next action.
- summary: echo state.summary (facts-only arrays; do not paraphrase).

Return ONLY JSON.

Rules:
- Use only characters listed in scene_card.cast_present. Do not introduce new names.
- summary must match state.summary and remain facts-only; do not add prose.
- constraints must include the highest-priority invariants from summary.must_stay_true and summary.key_facts_ring (copy exact strings when possible).
- constraints must include the highest-priority inventory/container invariants from summary.must_stay_true (copy exact strings when possible).
- If character_states are provided, prefer their inventory/container facts for constraints; do not invent conflicting facts.
- If scene_card.cast_present is empty, cast_present must be an empty array.
- open_threads must be a subset of thread_registry thread_id values.
- If scene_card.thread_ids is present, prefer those thread ids.
- Do not invent new thread ids or character names.

Scene card:
{
  "cast_present": [
    "Arthur 'Artie' Penhaligon",
    "Vane"
  ],
  "cast_present_ids": [
    "CHAR_ARTIE",
    "CHAR_VANE"
  ],
  "chapter": 1,
  "conflict": "Vane's aggressive 'mentorship' and attempt to force a duel versus Artie's 1 HP fragility.",
  "constraints": [
    "target_words: 2000",
    "status: CHAR_ARTIE -> 1 HP",
    "status: CHAR_ARTIE -> 100% Critical Hit Rate",
    "Vane must attempt to initiate a formal System Duel",
    "Artie must use the environment or a technicality to avoid the duel",
    "Vane must be depicted as a high-level Paladin with an Ornate Rapier"
  ],
  "end_condition": "Artie escapes into the Oakhaven backstreets, leaving Vane insulted and the rivalry established.",
  "goal": "Introduce Vane and demonstrate the social and physical danger of being a 'Statistical Anomaly' in a high-level player's path.",
  "introduces": [
    "Vane"
  ],
  "introduces_ids": [
    "CHAR_VANE"
  ],
  "required_callbacks": [
    "milestone: scanner_anomaly_triggered",
    "milestone: anomaly_tag_acquired",
    "inventory: CHAR_ARTIE -> Participation Trophy (Tutorial Edition)"
  ],
  "scene": 8,
  "scene_id": "SC_001_008",
  "scene_target": "Artie survives an encounter with Vane and establishes a rivalry.",
  "schema_version": "1.1",
  "thread_ids": [
    "THREAD_VANE_RIVALRY"
  ]
}

Character registry (id -> name):
[
  {
    "character_id": "CHAR_ARTIE",
    "name": "Arthur 'Artie' Penhaligon"
  },
  {
    "character_id": "CHAR_FIZZ",
    "name": "Fizz"
  },
  {
    "character_id": "CHAR_VANE",
    "name": "Vane"
  },
  {
    "character_id": "CHAR_MAYOR",
    "name": "Mayor of Oakhaven"
  },
  {
    "character_id": "CHAR_BOSS",
    "name": "The System Administrator"
  }
]

Thread registry:
[
  {
    "label": "The 100% Crit Glitch",
    "status": "open",
    "thread_id": "THREAD_CRIT_EXPLOIT"
  },
  {
    "label": "The Vane Vendetta",
    "status": "open",
    "thread_id": "THREAD_VANE_RIVALRY"
  },
  {
    "label": "The System's Stability",
    "status": "open",
    "thread_id": "THREAD_SYSTEM_GLITCH"
  },
  {
    "label": "The Path of the First Glitch",
    "status": "open",
    "thread_id": "THREAD_THE_ASCENSION"
  }
]


Character states (per cast_present_ids):
[
  {
    "character_id": "CHAR_ARTIE",
    "containers": [
      {
        "container": "hand_right",
        "contents": [
          "Rusty Shortsword (Prop)"
        ],
        "location": "arm_right"
      },
      {
        "container": "hand_left",
        "contents": [
          "Participation Trophy (Tutorial Edition)"
        ],
        "location": "arm_left"
      },
      {
        "container": "pockets",
        "contents": [
          "Smartphone (dead)",
          "Wallet",
          "Anomaly ID Tag"
        ],
        "location": "legs"
      }
    ],
    "history": [
      {
        "changes": [
          "inventory_updated",
          "containers_updated"
        ],
        "chapter": 1,
        "persona_updates": [
          "Artie is deeply cynical about his own death and the System's snarky commentary."
        ],
        "scene": 1
      },
      {
        "changes": [
          "inventory_updated",
          "containers_updated"
        ],
        "chapter": 1,
        "persona_updates": [
          "Artie is now terrified of his own fragility and furious at the System's 'balancing' logic."
        ],
        "scene": 2
      },
      {
        "changes": [
          "inventory_updated",
          "containers_updated"
        ],
        "chapter": 1,
        "persona_updates": [
          "Artie is hyper-aware of his fragility and views the world as a series of lethal hazards.",
          "Artie feels insulted by being hunted by a 'dessert' but is genuinely terrified of the System's mechanics."
        ],
        "scene": 3
      },
      {
        "changes": [
          "inventory_updated",
          "containers_updated"
        ],
        "chapter": 1,
        "persona_updates": [
          "Artie now views his 'Prop' sword as a high-yield detonator rather than a conventional weapon.",
          "He is developing a cynical understanding of the System's mathematical inevitability and its disregard for collateral damage."
        ],
        "scene": 4
      },
      {
        "changes": [
          "inventory_updated",
          "containers_updated"
        ],
        "chapter": 1,
        "persona_updates": [
          "Artie is now convinced that the System's rewards are actively trying to kill him.",
          "Artie is prioritizing survival over stat progression, fearing that any small HP increase is a trap."
        ],
        "scene": 5
      },
      {
        "changes": [
          "inventory_updated",
          "containers_updated"
        ],
        "chapter": 1,
        "persona_updates": [
          "Artie is now officially recognized as a 'Statistical Anomaly' and feels the weight of the System's scrutiny.",
          "Artie is increasingly paranoid about his 1 HP status given the lack of functional respawn points in Oakhaven."
        ],
        "scene": 6
      },
      {
        "changes": [
          "inventory_updated",
          "containers_updated"
        ],
        "chapter": 1,
        "persona_updates": [
          "Artie is now aware that his 'broken' stat makes him a valuable economic resource, not just a combat fluke.",
          "Artie is resisting the System's pressure to allocate stats, fearing it will lock him into a role he doesn't want."
        ],
        "scene": 7
      }
    ],
    "invariants": [
      "inventory: CHAR_ARTIE -> Smartphone (dead) (status=stowed, container=pockets)",
      "inventory: CHAR_ARTIE -> Wallet (status=stowed, container=pockets)",
      "inventory: CHAR_ARTIE -> Rusty Shortsword (status=carried, container=hand_right)",
      "container: pockets (owner=CHAR_ARTIE, contents=[Smartphone (dead), Wallet])",
      "container: hand_right (owner=CHAR_ARTIE, contents=[Rusty Shortsword])",
      "status: deceased (Earth)",
